properties.name: altTextDescription
properties.description: Specifies a string that represents the alternative text associated with the inline image.

examples.description: Set the alternative text description for an inline picture to "Company logo showing a blue mountain peak"

properties.name: altTextTitle
properties.description: Specifies a string that contains the title for the inline image.

examples.description: Set the alt text title of the first inline picture in the document to "Company Logo"

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from an inline picture to load and read its width property

properties.name: height
properties.description: Specifies a number that describes the height of the inline image.

examples.description: Set the height of an inline picture to 200 pixels

properties.name: hyperlink
properties.description: Specifies a hyperlink on the image. Use a '#' to separate the address part from the optional location part.

examples.description: Add a hyperlink to an inline picture that navigates to a specific website when clicked

properties.name: imageFormat
properties.description: Gets the format of the inline image.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the dimensions, format, and Base64-encoded data of the first inline picture in the document body.

properties.name: lockAspectRatio
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates whether the inline image retains its original proportions when you resize it.

examples.description: Lock the aspect ratio of the first inline picture in the document to prevent distortion when resizing

properties.name: paragraph
properties.description: Gets the parent paragraph that contains the inline image.

examples.description: Get the text content of the paragraph that contains the first inline picture in the document.

properties.name: parentContentControl
properties.description: Gets the content control that contains the inline image. Throws an ItemNotFound error if there isn't a parent content control.

examples.description: Check if an inline picture is inside a content control and highlight the parent content control in yellow if it exists.

properties.name: parentContentControlOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the content control that contains the inline image. If there isn't a parent content control, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see [OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

examples.description: Check if an inline picture is inside a content control and highlight the content control with a yellow background if it exists.

properties.name: parentTable
properties.description: Gets the table that contains the inline image. Throws an ItemNotFound error if it isn't contained in a table.

examples.description: Check if an inline picture is inside a table and if so, add a border around the parent table.

properties.name: parentTableCell
properties.description: Gets the table cell that contains the inline image. Throws an ItemNotFound error if it isn't contained in a table cell.

examples.description: Check if an inline picture is inside a table cell and highlight that cell with a yellow background color.

properties.name: parentTableCellOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the table cell that contains the inline image. If it isn't contained in a table cell, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see [OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

examples.description: Check if an inline picture is inside a table cell and highlight the cell in yellow if it is.

properties.name: parentTableOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the table that contains the inline image. If it isn't contained in a table, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see [OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

examples.description: Check if an inline picture is inside a table and if so, highlight the table with a light blue background color.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Specifies a number that describes the width of the inline image.

examples.description: Set the width of an inline picture to 200 pixels

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the inline picture from the document.

examples.description: Delete all inline pictures from the first paragraph of the document

methods.name: getBase64ImageSrc
methods.description: Gets the Base64-encoded string representation of the inline image.

examples.description: Retrieve the first inline picture from the document body and obtain its Base64-encoded image source along with its dimensions and format.

methods.name: getNext
methods.description: Gets the next inline image. Throws an ItemNotFound error if this inline image is the last one.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the alternative text title of the first inline picture in the document, or indicate if no inline pictures exist.

methods.name: getNextOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the next inline image. If this inline image is the last one, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see [OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

examples.description: Retrieve and display the alternative text title of the first inline picture in the document, or indicate if no inline pictures exist.

methods.name: getRange
methods.description: Gets the picture, or the starting or ending point of the picture, as a range.

params.name: rangeLocation
params.description: The range location must be 'Whole', 'Start', or 'End'.

examples.description: Get the range of the first inline picture in the document and highlight it with yellow color

methods.name: insertBreak
methods.description: Inserts a break at the specified location in the main document.

params.name: breakType
params.description: The break type to add.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: The value must be 'Before' or 'After'.

examples.description: Insert a page break after the first inline picture in the document

methods.name: insertContentControl
methods.description: Wraps the inline picture with a rich text content control.

examples.description: Wrap an inline picture with a rich text content control and set its title to "Product Image"

methods.name: insertFileFromBase64
methods.description: Inserts a document at the specified location.

params.name: base64File
params.description: The Base64-encoded content of a .docx file.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: The value must be 'Before' or 'After'.

examples.description: Insert a company logo image from base64 data before an inline picture in the document

methods.name: insertHtml
methods.description: Inserts HTML at the specified location.

params.name: html
params.description: The HTML to be inserted.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: The value must be 'Before' or 'After'.

examples.description: Insert a formatted HTML snippet with a heading and paragraph after an inline picture in the document

methods.name: insertInlinePictureFromBase64
methods.description: Inserts an inline picture at the specified location.

params.name: base64EncodedImage
params.description: The Base64-encoded image to be inserted.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: The value must be 'Replace', 'Before', or 'After'.

examples.description: Insert a company logo image from base64 encoding before an existing inline picture in the document

methods.name: insertOoxml
methods.description: Inserts OOXML at the specified location.

params.name: ooxml
params.description: The OOXML to be inserted.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: The value must be 'Before' or 'After'.

examples.description: Insert a formatted text box using OOXML before an existing inline picture in the document
examples.usage_code:
await Word.run(async (context) => {
    // Get the first inline picture in the document
    const inlinePicture = context.document.body.inlinePictures.getFirst();
    
    // OOXML for a simple text box with formatted text
    const ooxml = `
        <pkg:package xmlns:pkg="http://schemas.microsoft.com/office/2006/xmlPackage">
            <pkg:part pkg:name="/_rels/.rels" pkg:contentType="application/vnd.openxmlformats-package.relationships+xml">
                <pkg:xmlData>
                    <Relationships xmlns="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/package/2006/relationships">
                        <Relationship Id="rId1" Type="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/officeDocument/2006/relationships/officeDocument" Target="word/document.xml"/>
                    </Relationships>
                </pkg:xmlData>
            </pkg:part>
            <pkg:part pkg:name="/word/document.xml" pkg:contentType="application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document.main+xml">
                <pkg:xmlData>
                    <w:document xmlns:w="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/wordprocessingml/2006/main">
                        <w:body>
                            <w:p>
                                <w:r>
                                    <w:rPr>
                                        <w:b/>
                                        <w:color w:val="FF0000"/>
                                    </w:rPr>
                                    <w:t>Important Note</w:t>
                                </w:r>
                            </w:p>
                        </w:body>
                    </w:document>
                </pkg:xmlData>
            </pkg:part>
        </pkg:package>`;
    
    // Insert the OOXML before the inline picture
    inlinePicture.insertOoxml(ooxml, Word.InsertLocation.before);
    
    await context.sync();
});

methods.name: insertParagraph
methods.description: Inserts a paragraph at the specified location.

params.name: paragraphText
params.description: The paragraph text to be inserted.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: The value must be 'Before' or 'After'.

examples.description: Insert a paragraph with text below an inline picture in the document

methods.name: insertText
methods.description: Inserts text at the specified location.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to be inserted.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: The value must be 'Before' or 'After'.

examples.description: Insert the text "Figure 1: " before an inline picture in the document

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the width and height properties of the first inline picture in the document

methods.name: select
methods.description: Selects the inline picture. This causes Word to scroll to the selection.

params.name: selectionMode
params.description: The selection mode must be 'Select', 'Start', or 'End'. 'Select' is the default.

params.name: selectionMode
params.description: The selection mode must be 'Select', 'Start', or 'End'. 'Select' is the default.

examples.description: Select the first inline picture in the document to highlight it and scroll it into view

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Update an inline picture's dimensions and alt text by setting multiple properties at once

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.InlinePicture object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.InlinePictureData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Get the properties of an inline picture as a plain JavaScript object and log it to the console for debugging or serialization purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track an inline picture object to maintain its reference across multiple sync calls when modifying its properties in separate batches

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Insert an inline picture, use it to get its dimensions, then untrack it to free memory after the operation is complete.
